name: Hell Knight
description:
Careful planning and uptight caution are nothing but a cause to doubt oneself. Hell Knights realize this fact, and instead opt to send their creatures charging headlong into battle, relying on brute strength and reckless attacks to ensure a swift victory.
As a Hell Knight, you'll favor creatures that specialize in attacking. Hell Knights grant their creatures increased critical damage and cause a variety of effects to occur when they attack. Hell Knights are surprisingly adept at spellcasting in a pinch, as well.

perks.name: Blazing Soul
perks.description: When your creatures afflict enemies with Burning, their Attack is used to determine the potency of this debuff if it is higher than their Intelligence.

perks.name: Bolster
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage from attacks and spells for every 1% of Health they're missing.

perks.name: Deadly Calm
perks.description: Enemies cannot Provoke.

perks.name: Death Sentence
perks.description: Your creatures' critical attacks deal 2% more damage per rank. Maximum Bonus: 60% extra damage

perks.name: Dreadnaught
perks.description: Your creatures' attacks cannot be dodged.

perks.name: Enduring Rage
perks.description: Your creatures Attack an additional time.

perks.name: Executioner
perks.description: Your creatures deal 1% more damage per rank with attacks. Maximum Bonus: 50% more damage

perks.name: Indomitable
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Scorned.

perks.name: Inner Focus
perks.description: When your creatures cast a spell, 1% of their Attack per rank is added to their Intelligence to determine the amount of damage dealt. Maximum Bonus: 25% of attack stat contributed

perks.name: Kindling
perks.description: At the start of battle, the first creature in your party casts Firestorm.

perks.name: Magma Diver
perks.description: Your creatures always have Splashing and Savage.

perks.name: Massacre
perks.description: Your creatures' Splashing debuff now deals damage to all enemies.

perks.name: Pyromania
perks.description: After your creatures attack, they have a 1% chance per rank to cast Flamestrike. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Reckless Abandon
perks.description: Your creatures' Savage buff now causes them to have a 100% chance to deal critical damage.

perks.name: Touch of Chaos
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, they have a 1% chance per rank to afflict the target with a random debuff. Maximum Bonus: 25% chance

perks.name: Hellion (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures deal 5% more damage with attacks for each time they've Attacked in the current battle.

name: Reaver
description:
Perseverance, an iron will, and a touch of insanity are the perfect recipe for victory. Reavers live and die by this mantra, instilling their creatures with a cold and calculated anger that allows them to grow more powerful during battle while their foes tire out.
As a Reaver, your creatures will gain massive benefits in combat as battle continue to drag on. If your creatures manage to survive for just a few extra turns, they'll be able to devastate your enemies.

perks.name: Blitzkrieg
perks.description: Your creatures' attacks that happen simultaneously to the same target deal 1% more damage per rank than the last. Maximum Bonus: 50% more damage

perks.name: Controlled Anger
perks.description: After your creatures take 2 turns, they become immune to debuffs for the rest of the battle.

perks.name: Mental Clarity
perks.description: After your creatures take 2 turns, they can Cast spells without consuming any Charges for the rest of the battle.

perks.name: Mercurial
perks.description: After your creatures are Attacked, and they fail to dodge the attack, their chance to dodge attacks is doubled the next time they're Attacked. This effect stacks multiple times in a row until they successfully dodge an attack.

perks.name: Onslaught
perks.description: Your creatures deal 5% more damage and take 5% less damage for each battle you've won in the current realm. If you're not in a realm, this perk acts as if you've won 8 battles.

perks.name: Proliferation
perks.description: Your creatures deal 30% more damage for each turn they've taken in battle.

perks.name: Rapid Exhaustion
perks.description: Battle fatigue accumulates 2% faster per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% quicker fatigue rate

perks.name: Red-eye Flight
perks.description: Battle fatigue starts to accumulates 1 turn sooner per rank. Maximum Bonus: 25 turns earlier

perks.name: Reign of Chaos
perks.description: Your creatures have 1% more Attack, Intelligence, Defense and Speed per rank for each battle you've won in the current realm. Maximum Bonus: 15% more stats per battle

perks.name: Relentless
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, and the attack fails to deal critical damage, their chance to deal critical damage with attacks is doubled on their next turn. This effect stacks multiple times in a row until the creature deals critical damage with attacks.

perks.name: Reverberation
perks.description: Your creatures Attack and Cast an additional time for every 2 turns they've taken in battle.

perks.name: Rigor
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Snared, Frozen, and Sleeping.

perks.name: Sap
perks.description: Enemies take 5% more damage per rank from battle fatigue. Maximum Bonus: 50% extra damage

perks.name: Skirmish
perks.description: Your creatures have a 1% chance per rank to Attack an additional time. This effect can occur repeatedly until it fails. Maximum Bonus: 25% chance

perks.name: Stimulation
perks.description: Your creatures no longer take extra damage from battle fatigue.

perks.name: Sure-footed
perks.description: Enemies cannot move your creatures down the Timeline.

perks.name: Uncontrollable Anger (ASCENSION)
perks.description: If your creatures have taken at least 2 turns, they Attack a random enemy at the start of their turn.

name: Pyromancer
description:
Pyromancers quite literally thrive on watching the world burn. These maniacal magi ignite both friend and foe alike with a brilliant conflagration, causing their enemies to suffer gruesome deaths while empowering their allies with the power of flame.
As a Pyromancer, you'll make heavy use of the Burning debuff to deal damage to enemies over time. In addition, your own creatures will be afflicted with this debuff, but it will heal and empower them rather than dealing damage.

perks.name: Backdraft
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from Burning, they are afflicted with either Scorned or Silenced.

perks.name: Burn Out
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 1% of the potency of their Burning debuff per rank. Maximum Bonus: 20% of Burn potency

perks.name: Burn Their Corpses
perks.description: If an enemy dies while it is afflicted with Burning, it cannot be resurrected.

perks.name: Cauterize
perks.description: After your creatures are damaged or healed by Burning, they gain Shelled. Your creatures' Shelled ignores the Burning debuff.

perks.name: Combustion
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from Burning, they have a 1% chance per rank to be sent to the bottom of the Timeline. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Conflagration
perks.description: After your creatures are damaged or healed by Burning, a random enemy takes damage equal to 5% of this amount per rank as well. Maximum Bonus: 100% of the amount

perks.name: Firestarter
perks.description: Enemies always have Burning.

perks.name: Flashover
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from Burning, they are afflicted with Bomb.

perks.name: From Ashes
perks.description: After your creatures with Burning are killed, they have a 1% chance per rank to be resurrected with 50% Health.

perks.name: Hot Streak
perks.description: After your creatures are damaged or healed by Burning, the potency of all creatures' Burning debuffs increases by 2% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% potency increase

perks.name: Immolation
perks.description: Your creatures' spells that interact with Burning have 5% more potency per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% more potency

perks.name: Kindle the Flame
perks.description: Your creatures' spells that interact with Burning do not consume Charges.

perks.name: Living Flame
perks.description: Your creatures always have Burning. Instead of taking damage from this debuff, they are healed by it instead.

perks.name: Pyroblast
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from Burning, each of your creatures have a 2% chance per rank to cast a Scourge spell on an enemy. The type of Scourge spell is based on the enemy's class. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Roaring Blaze
perks.description: After an enemy with Burning is killed, enemies take damage equal to 5% of the potency of that creature's Burning debuff per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% of the potency

perks.name: Empowering Flames (ASCENSION)
perks.description: After your creatures are healed by Living Flame, they gain Attack and Intelligence equal to 100% of the amount of healing done.

name: Necromancer
description:
Necromancers prefer to overwhelm their foes by summoning minions to aid their creatures in battle. Enemies are often so perplexed by the number of undead monstrosities charging at them from across the battlefield that they're dead long before they realize what even happened.
As a Necromancer, you'll summon minions to aid your creatures in battle. These minions can do all kinds of things to support your creatures - they can cause damage, boost your creatures' stats, debuff enemies, and much more.

perks.name: Animated Dead
perks.description: Your creatures start battles with 1 Zombie per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 Zombies

perks.name: Army of the Damned
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, their minions gain 1 additional stack.

perks.name: Conquest's Triumph
perks.description: After your creatures Cast a spell, they summon Conquest.

perks.name: Corpse Eater
perks.description: Your creatures start battles with 1 Writhelings per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 Writhelings

perks.name: Cruel Creation
perks.description: Your creatures start battles with 1 Unstable Horror per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 Unstable Horrors

perks.name: Deadly Vitality
perks.description: After your creatures gain a minion or a minion stack, they recover Health equal to 1% of their Maximum Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: Heal for 20% of Maximum Health

perks.name: Death's Claim
perks.description: At the end of your creatures' turns, they summon Death.

perks.name: Famine's Thirst
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, they summon Famine.

perks.name: Four Horsemen
perks.description: If your creatures have Conquest, Famine, Death, and War, they cast Apocalypse at the start of their turns. Your creatures are healed by this spell.

perks.name: Gravewalker
perks.description: After your creatures are killed, they have a 1% chance per rank to be resurrected with 50% Health for each different minion they had before they died. Maximum Bonus: 10% chance per minion type

perks.name: Meat Shield
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage per rank for each different minion they have. Maximum Bonus: 10% less damage per minion type

perks.name: Midnight Bargain
perks.description: Your creatures' minions are 2% less likely per rank to go away. Maximum Bonus: 100% reduced chance (Minions never leave)

perks.name: Servitude
perks.description: Your creatures deal 1% more damage per rank for each different minion they have. Maximum Bonus: 15% more damage per minion type

perks.name: Undying Loyalty
perks.description: Your creatures' minions persist beyond their master's death.

perks.name: War's Victory
perks.description: After your creatures are damaged by an attack or spell, they summon War.

perks.name: Amalgamation (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures start battles with Amalgamation.

name: Defiler
description:
The difference between good and evil is often a matter of perspective, but the morality of a Defiler is simple enough for anyone to decide. These dark magi take sadistic pleasure in afflicting their adversaries with crippling diseases, reducing them to weakened husks that no longer have the capacity to defend themselves.
As a Defiler, you'll specialize in debuffs and stat-reducing effects. Enemies will be so weak that your party will be able to easily pick them off, even if they were originally much more powerful than your creatures.

perks.name: Anemia
perks.description: Enemies' Weak debuffs are 5% more effective per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% more effect

perks.name: Curse of Fragility
perks.description: Enemies have 1% less Maximum Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: 35% less Health

perks.name: Curse of Futility
perks.description: Enemies have 1% less Intelligence per rank. Maximum Bonus: 35% less Intelligence

perks.name: Curse of Impotence
perks.description: Enemies have 1% less Attack per rank. Maximum Bonus: 35% less Attack

perks.name: Curse of Lethargy
perks.description: Enemies have 1% less Speed per rank. Maximum Bonus: 35% less Speed

perks.name: Curse of Vulnerability
perks.description: Enemies have 1% less Defense per rank. Maximum Bonus: 35% less Defense

perks.name: Daybreaker
perks.description: Enemies take 10% more damage for each debuff they have.

perks.name: Hopelessness
perks.description: Enemies' buffs last for only 1 turn and their minions have double the chance to leave battle.

perks.name: Horror Show
perks.description: Enemies with Feared have a 1% chance per rank to lose their turns. Maximum Bonus: 25% chance

perks.name: Impiety
perks.description: Your creatures ignore enemies' Shelled and Barrier buffs.

perks.name: Infirmity
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemies are afflicted with 1 random debuff per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 debuffs

perks.name: Languish
perks.description: Increases the potency of your creatures' effects that decrease enemies' stats by 2% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% greater potency

perks.name: Lingering Sickness
perks.description: Enemies' debuffs last forever.

perks.name: Nighttaker
perks.description: Enemies deal 5% less damage (up to 90%) for each debuff they have.

perks.name: Tenderness
perks.description: Enemies' Vulnerable debuffs are 5% more effective per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% more effect

perks.name: Tragedy
perks.description: Decreases the potency of enemies' effects that increase their stats by 2% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% less effect

perks.name: Unholy Night
perks.description: After your creatures afflict enemies with a debuff, they deal damage to them equal to 80% of their lowest stat.

perks.name: Wane
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemies lose 1% Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: 20% Health loss

perks.name: Death's Due (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage with attacks and spells equal to the amount of their highest stat they have greater than the target's highest stat.

name: Animator
description:
There's a fine line between genius and insanity, and it's difficult to say on what side of that line Animators reside. These fanatical magi spend their days perfecting their Animatus creations: unique creatures that grow more powerful as their master's dark experiments unveil new opportunities.
As an Animator, you will always have a unique creature in your party called an Animatus. Your entire battle strategy will likely focus on this creature. You can empower your Animatus, and even use your other creatures to make it stronger in combat.

perks.name: Anguish Through Awareness
perks.description: Your Animatus starts battles with 1 random buff per rank. Maximum Bonus: 5 buffs

perks.name: Cogmind
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Animatus gains copies of your fourth creature's first 5 Spell Gems.

perks.name: Damnation's Edge
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Animatus gains a copy of your fifth creature's innate trait.

perks.name: Dancing Blade
perks.description: Your Animatus always has Animated Weapon.

perks.name: Dark Anima
perks.description: Your Animatus always has Animated Gem.

perks.name: Death and Decay
perks.description: When an enemy is killed, your Animatus casts Corpse Explosion. This spell deals 50% more damage for each dead enemy.

perks.name: Desensitization
perks.description: Your Animatus is immune to debuffs in normal battles, and resistant to debuffs in boss battles.

perks.name: Endowment
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Animatus fuses with a copy of the second creature in your party. In addition, its race changes to that creature's race.

perks.name: Forbidden Magic
perks.description: The first time your Animatus is killed in battle, it resurrects with 100% Health. Maximum Bonus: Resurrect 3 times

perks.name: Forged by Pain
perks.description: Your Animatus splits the damage it takes with your sixth creature.

perks.name: Gray Matter
perks.description: Your Animatus gains 1 Spell Slot per rank. Maximum Bonus: 5 extra slots

perks.name: Grimkeeper
perks.description: Your Animatus' buffs and minions persist through death.

perks.name: Masterpiece
perks.description: After your creatures gain a buff, your Animatus gains that buff as well.

perks.name: Molecular Betrayal
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Animatus gains 1% of your third creature's stats per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% stat theft

perks.name: Thrive on Death
perks.description: After your creatures are killed, your Animatus gains 1% of their stats per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% stat gain

perks.name: Live to Serve (ASCENSION)
perks.description: After your Animatus is resurrected, your other creatures are resurrected with 100% Health.

name: Bloodmage
description:
The Blood Mage is a deranged spellcaster who is willing to do anything to overcome his foes - even at the cost of his own creatures' lives. This menacing spellcaster is adept at manipulating the lifeforce of allies and foes alike in his endless pursuit for power.
As a Blood Mage, your creatures will grow more powerful as they take damage. To facilitate these effects, the Blood Mage offers a variety of different ways to inflict damage on his own creatures.

perks.name: Bleed Out
perks.description: The first time your creatures are killed in battle, they are resurrected with 100% Health, and then they take damage equal to 50% of their Maximum Health.

perks.name: Blood Clot
perks.description: After your creatures take damage, they gain a Barrier that absorbs damage equal to 2% of the amount of damage taken per rank. Maximum Bonus: Barrier equal to 50% of damage taken

perks.name: Blood-caked Blade
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 1% of the total damage they took in the current battle per rank. Maximum Bonus: Additional damage equal to 75% of damage taken

perks.name: Bloodrage
perks.description: Your creatures' damage with attacks is based on 50% of their Maximum Health instead of their Attack.

perks.name: Bloodthirst
perks.description: The potency of your creatures' spells is based on 50% of their Maximum Health instead of their Intelligence.

perks.name: Bloody Massacre
perks.description: Enemies always have Bleeding. After an enemy takes damage from Bleeding, your creatures recover Health equal to 3% of the damage taken. Maximum Bonus: Healing equal to 50% of the damage taken

perks.name: Deathrattle
perks.description: Your creatures' stats are no longer reset after they're killed.

perks.name: Endless Slaughter
perks.description: Your creatures Attack and Cast spells 1 additional time for every 20% Health they're missing.

perks.name: Hemostasis
perks.description: Your creatures can take damage a maximum of 1 time during their turn.

perks.name: March Toward Death
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 50% of the amount of Health they're missing.

perks.name: Masochistic Tendencies
perks.description: Your creatures' spells no longer consume Charges. Before your creatures Cast a spell, they deal damage to themselves equal to 25% of their Maximum Health.

perks.name: Relish In Blood
perks.description: Your creatures have additional Attack, Intelligence, Defense and Speed equal to 1% of their missing and Maximum Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: Stats equal to 10% of missing and max Health

perks.name: Sacrifice
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures Health is set to 50% and they gain 1 random buff per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 random Buffs

perks.name: Sanguine Fortitude
perks.description: Your creatures take less damage equal to 1% of the total amount of damage they took in the current battle per rank. Maximum Bonus: 10% of total damage

perks.name: Transfusion
perks.description: After one of your creatures takes damage and is not killed, one of your other creatures gains Maximum Health equal to 25% of the damage taken.

perks.name: Voracity
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage with attacks and spells equal to 2% of their Current Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% of Maximum Health

perks.name: Blood Offering (ASCENSION)
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures grant each other Maximum Health equal to 10% of their Maximum Health.

name: Cleric
description:
The best offense, as some say, is a good defense. Clerics protect their creatures with powerful healing abilities and steadfast barriers, ensuring that not even the most tenacious of foes can overcome them.
As a Cleric, you'll specialize in healing abilities, as well as buffing, resurrection, stat-boosting effects, and providing your creatures with protective barriers. Your creatures will be extremely difficult to kill.

perks.name: Apotheosis
perks.description: After your creatures are healed, they have a 2% chance per rank to gain a random buff. Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Consecrated Ground
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Blighted.

perks.name: Greater Healing
perks.description: Your creatures' healing effects are 4% more powerful per rank. Your creatures gain 2% more benefit per rank from healing effects. Maximum Bonus: 100% healing given and received

perks.name: Guardian Angel
perks.description: You have a 1% chance per rank to negate enemy attacks and spells. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Guiding Light
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain a Barrier that absorbs damage equal to 1% of their Maximum Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: Barrier adds 50% of max health

perks.name: Holy Might
perks.description: Your creatures deal 1% more damage per rank for each buff they have. Maximum Bonus: 10% more damage

perks.name: Inner Light
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage per rank from all sources. Maximum Bonus: 40% less damage

perks.name: Lenience
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage per rank for each buff they have. Maximum Bonus: 5% less damage

perks.name: Luminesce
perks.description: After your creatures are healed, and the amount healed exceeds the creature's Maximum Health, store the extra healing as a Barrier.

perks.name: Overheal
perks.description: Your creatures can trigger healing effects even while they're at full Health.

perks.name: Premonition
perks.description: While your creatures have a Barrier, they take 1% less damage per rank from all sources. Maximum Bonus: 30% less damage

perks.name: Radiance
perks.description: Increases the potency of your creatures' effects that increase their stats by 2% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 60% extra potency

perks.name: Revelation
perks.description: At the end of your creatures' turns, your dead creatures have a 1.5% chance per rank to be resurrected with 50% health. Maximum Bonus: 30% chance

perks.name: Saving Grace
perks.description: After your creatures are resurrected, they gain a Barrier equal to 2% of their Maximum Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: Barrier adds 100% of Max Health

perks.name: Strength of Soul
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 1% of their Barrier strength per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% additional damage

perks.name: Holy Burst (ASCENSION)
perks.description: At the end of your creatures' turns, they Cast Holy Fire if they have Barrier.

name: Inquisitor
description:
Burn the witch, judge the heretic, and slay the non-believer. Inquisitors make use of healing effects just as much for offense as they do for defense. They enact justice on behalf of the gods, and no one will be spared from holy rapture.
As an Inquisitor, you'll have a solution at your disposal for every problem you encounter. In addition, Inquisitors are able ot use healing effects for offensive purposes - for example, when your creatures heal enemies, they instead cause damage to them.

perks.name: Admonish
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemy Sorcery creatures are afflicted with Silenced and lose 30% Intelligence.

perks.name: Begrudge
perks.description: After an enemy Casts a spell, that Spell Gem is sealed.

perks.name: Berate
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemy Life creatures are afflicted with Blighted and lose 30% Maximum Health.

perks.name: Castigate
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemy Chaos creatures are afflicted with Scorned and lose 30% Attack.

perks.name: Censure
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 2% per rank of the healing they've received in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 40% of healing received

perks.name: Condemn
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemy Death creatures are afflicted with Vulnerable and lose 30% Defense.

perks.name: Contrition
perks.description: After an enemy attacks, they have a 4% chance per rank to be afflicted with Scorned. Maximum Bonus: 100% chance

perks.name: Defy Evil
perks.description: Your creatures' damage from attacks and spells ignores 2.5% of the enemies' Defense per rank. Maximum Bonus: Ignore 25% Defense

perks.name: Divine Strength
perks.description: After your creatures are healed, they gain Attack and Intelligence equal to 1% of the healing received per rank. Maximum Bonus: Boost equal to 25% of healing

perks.name: Flagellation
perks.description: Your creatures' healing effects deal damage when applied to enemies.

perks.name: Heresy
perks.description: When your creatures deal damage with an attack or spell, they deal 30% more damage for each debuff and Sealed Spell Gem the target has.

perks.name: Judgment
perks.description: After an enemy Casts a spell, they have a 4% chance per rank to be afflicted with Silenced. Maximum Bonus: 100% chance

perks.name: Lay to Rest
perks.description: Enemies can only resurrect once per battle.

perks.name: Miracle
perks.description: After your creatures are resurrected, they deal damage to all enemies equal to 1.5% of their Maximum Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: 37.5% of max health in damage

perks.name: Rebuke
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemy Nature creatures are afflicted with Feared and lose 30% Speed.

perks.name: Shining Force
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain Rebirth.

perks.name: Judgment Day (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures deal 150% more damage and take 65% less damage as a result of their class strength.

name: Monk
description:
A strong defense is unnecessary when your foe is unable to strike you in the first place. Monks grant their creatures unmatched agility, enabling them to dodge incoming attacks and spells, and respond with devastating counter-attacks.
As a Monk, you'll boost your creatures' chance to Dodge attacks and spells. When your creatures Dodge, they'll unleash a devastating counter-attack on the enemy.

perks.name: Blurred Strikes
perks.description: After your creatures counter-attack with Celerity, they have a 2.5% chance per rank to Attack an additional time. This effect can occur repeatedly. Maximum Bonus: 62.5% chance

perks.name: Celerity
perks.description: After your creatures Dodge, they counter-attack the enemy.

perks.name: Crosswinds
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 1% of their Speed per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% of Speed contributed

perks.name: Dampen Harm
perks.description: When your creatures would receive fatal damage, they have a chance to prevent that damage equal to their chance to dodge.

perks.name: Extended Reach
perks.description: After your creatures counter-attack with Celerity, they have a 1% chance per rank to move to the top of the Timeline. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Fake Out
perks.description: After an enemy Dodges your creatures' attacks, they have a 3% chance per rank to Attack again. Maximum Bonus: 75% chance

perks.name: Fortified Spirit
perks.description: After your creatures Dodge, they gain 1% Defense per rank for each time they've Attacked with Celerity. Maximum Bonus: 10% Defense gain per celerity attack

perks.name: Good Karma
perks.description: Your creatures always have Agile, and their Agile buff has a 5% greater chance to activate per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% greater chance

perks.name: Pressure Point
perks.description: Increases your creatures' damage dealt with Celerity by 2% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% damage increase

perks.name: Protective Winds
perks.description: Your creatures have an independent 3% chance per rank to Dodge attacks. Maximum Bonus: 75% chance

perks.name: Ride the Wind
perks.description: While your creatures are Defending, they receive a bonus to their Speed instead of Defense.

perks.name: Serenity
perks.description: 5% of your creatures' chance to Dodge attacks per rank is applied to spells as well. This perk ignores independent chances to dodge attacks granted by other effects. Maximum Bonus: 100% of dodge chance applied

perks.name: Spiritual Attunement
perks.description: After your creatures take indirect damage, they have a 1% chance per rank to prevent that damage. Maximum Bonus: 50% of Serenity chance applied

perks.name: Thylacine's Fury
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 50% of the amount of Speed they have greater than their target.

perks.name: Vital Strike
perks.description: When your creatures counter-attack with Celerity, the attack has a 2% chance per rank to deal double damage. Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Windwalker (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures have a 5% chance (up to 80%) to avoid damage for each time all your creatures dodged in the current battle.

name: Warden
description:
Wardens are wholly attuned to the needs of their creatures. These powerful magi empower their creatures with various boons to give them an edge over their opponents in battle.
As a Warden, you'll be able to grant your creatures every buff in existence. In addition, your creatures will grow stronger as they continue to accumulate more buffs.

perks.name: Alpha
perks.description: After your creatures Provoke, they gain Taunting and Protected.

perks.name: Awareness
perks.description: After your creatures Defend, they gain Defensive and Rebirth.

perks.name: Bristle
perks.description: After your creatures take damage from a spell, they gain Repelling and Shelled.

perks.name: Convocation
perks.description: After your creatures Cast a spell, they gain Arcane.

perks.name: Earthen Frenzy
perks.description: After your creatures gain a buff, they have a 2% chance per rank to Attack a random enemy. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Eternal Guardian
perks.description: Your creatures' buffs persist through death.

perks.name: Graceful Spirit
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, they gain a Barrier that absorbs damage equal to 1% of their Maximum Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: 25% of Maximum Health

perks.name: Grove Ward
perks.description: After your creatures lose stats, they gain Warded.

perks.name: Luster
perks.description: After your creatures take damage from an attack, they gain Agile and Mending.

perks.name: Moment of Clarity
perks.description: After your creatures gain a buff, they have a 2% chance per rank to Cast one of their spells. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Nature's Boon
perks.description: Your creatures have 1% more stats (other than Health) per rank for each buff they have. Maximum Bonus: 10% more stats

perks.name: Overrun
perks.description: After your creatures gain a buff, they recover 3% Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: 30% Health recovered

perks.name: Predator
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, they gain Splashing and Savage.

perks.name: Preparation
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain Invisible and Proficient.

perks.name: Primal Vengeance
perks.description: After one of your creatures are killed, all your creatures gain Berserk and Leeching.

perks.name: Soul of the Forest
perks.description: After your creatures gain a buff, they gain 2% per rank of a random stat. Maximum Bonus: 20% stat gain

perks.name: Spirit Shield
perks.description: Your creatures deal 2% more damage per rank and take 1% less damage per rank for each buff they have. Maximum Bonus: 10% more damage, 5% less damage

perks.name: Survival of the Fittest
perks.description: After your creatures gain a buff and they already have at least 7 other buffs, they gain Immune.

perks.name: Unending Boon (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures' buffs last forever. In addition, when one of your creature's buffs would be forcefully removed (for example, if your creature with Invisible makes an action), they have a 30% chance to retain that buff.

name: Witch Doctor
description:
Witch Doctors are spiritual warriors who cast deadly hexes and curses on their enemies, forcing them to fight against each other.
As a Witch Doctor, you'll manipulate your foes into damaging each other and empowering your creatures to ensure victory.

perks.name: Backbite
perks.description: Enemies have a 100% greater chance to deal critical damage to their allies.

perks.name: Bad Medicine
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain Secret Stuff.

perks.name: Bewitch
perks.description: After an enemy Attacks one of its allies, your creatures gain a random buff.

perks.name: Blind Eye
perks.description: Enemies cannot dodge attacks from their allies.

perks.name: Hedge Magic
perks.description: Enemies take 10% more damage per rank from their allies. Maximum Bonus: 100% more damage

perks.name: Hex
perks.description: Enemies with Confused have a 5% chance per rank to lower their allies' stats instead of increasing them. Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Initiation Rite
perks.description: When an enemy Attacks one of its allies, its highest stat is used to determine the damage dealt.

perks.name: Jinx
perks.description: Enemies always have Cursed.

perks.name: Maledict
perks.description: Enemies take additional damage equal to 5% of the damage they've taken from their allies in the current battle per rank. Maximum Bonus: 15% of taken damage

perks.name: Mass Hysteria
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from an ally, they are afflicted with Blind and Confused.

perks.name: Mumbo Jumbo
perks.description: Enemies with Confused have a 5% chance per rank to afflict allies with a debuff instead of a buff. Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Terrorize
perks.description: After an enemy Attacks one of its allies, it afflicts the target with a random debuff.

perks.name: Trance
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, they have a 5% chance per rank to Cast Mind Control on the target. Maximum Bonus: 25% chance

perks.name: Vision Quest
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain Doppelganger.

perks.name: Voodoo
perks.description: When an enemy Casts a spell on one of its allies, its highest stat is used to determine the potency of the spell.

perks.name: Cursed Omen (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Enemies Attack and Cast spells on their allies 1 additional time.

name: Evoker
description:
Evokers are the ultimate spellcasters. They excel at casting enhanced versions of spells multiple times in a row to overwhelm their enemies before they can act.
As an Evoker, you'll empower your creatures' spellcasting capabilities. Your creatures will be able to cast the same spell multiple times in one turn, and these spells will be much stronger than if they had cast them without your guidance.

perks.name: Arcane Fortitude
perks.description: Your creatures take 2% less damage (up to 90%) per rank for each non-Ethereal Spell Gem they have that does not belong to their own class. Maximum Bonus: 10% less damage

perks.name: Arcane Power
perks.description: Your creatures deal 2% more damage per rank for each non-Ethereal Spell Gem they have that does not belong to their own class. Maximum Bonus: 10% more damage

perks.name: Burst
perks.description: Your creatures' spells that are cast in the same turn deal 1% more damage per rank than the last. Maximum Bonus: 50% more damage

perks.name: Chaos Mastery
perks.description: Your creatures can equip Chaos Spell Gems, regardless of their class.

perks.name: Death Mastery
perks.description: Your creatures can equip Death Spell Gems, regardless of their class.

perks.name: Echo
perks.description: Your creatures Cast spells an additional time.

perks.name: Efficiency
perks.description: Your creatures' extra casts no longer consume additional Charges.

perks.name: Expanded Mind
perks.description: Your creatures can equip 1 additional Spell Gem per rank. Maximum Bonus: 5 extra Gems

perks.name: Life Mastery
perks.description: Your creatures can equip Life Spell Gems, regardless of their class.

perks.name: Mirror Image
perks.description: Your creatures have a 1% chance per rank to Cast spells an additional time. This effect can occur repeatedly until it fails. Maximum Bonus: 25% chance

perks.name: Nature Mastery
perks.description: Your creatures can equip Nature Spell Gems, regardless of their class.

perks.name: Outspoken
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Silenced.

perks.name: Sorcery Mastery
perks.description: Your creatures can equip Sorcery Spell Gems, regardless of their class.

perks.name: Spell Corruption
perks.description: Your creatures' spells affect stats 1% more per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% extra effect

perks.name: Spell Mending
perks.description: Your creatures' spells heal 1% more Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% extra effect

perks.name: Spell Power
perks.description: Your creatures' spells deal 1% more damage per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% extra effect

perks.name: Supercharged
perks.description: Your creatures' spells have 1 additional Charge per rank. Maximum Bonus: 5 extra Charges

perks.name: Overload (ASCENSION)
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast a spell, each of their other Spell Gems that belong to a different class have a 50% chance to be Cast as well. Maximum of 1 spell per class.

name: Cabalist
description:
Cabalists can conjure Spell Gems out of thin air to be used by their creatures at any given moment. These magi prefer to employ high-risk, high-reward battle strategies to ensure their victory.
As a Cabalist, you'll enable your creatures to cast spells that they normally wouldn't have access to. While other people's creatures might run out of Spell Gem Charges, you'll be able to keep your creatures well-stocked with fresh Spell Gems at the start of every battle.

perks.name: Apex
perks.description: Your creatures deal 1% more damage per rank for each Ethereal Spell Gem they have equipped. Maximum Bonus: 5% more damage per gem

perks.name: Battle Mage
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, they have a 2% chance per rank to cast one of their Ethereal Spell Gems. Maximum Bonus: 100% chance

perks.name: Familiar
perks.description: After your creatures cast an Ethereal Spell Gem, they have a 2% chance per rank to summon an Animated Gem. Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Flow of Magic
perks.description: After your creatures manually cast an Ethereal Spell Gem, they gain 50% Intelligence.

perks.name: Hand of the Magi
perks.description: Your creatures' Ethereal Spell Gems have 2% more potency per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% more potency

perks.name: Incantation
perks.description: After your creatures Defend or Provoke, they cast one of their Ethereal Spell Gems.

perks.name: Invoke
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, they gain an Ethereal Spell Gem.

perks.name: Mystify
perks.description: After your creatures cast an Ethereal Spell Gem, 1 enemy per rank is afflicted with a random debuff. Maximum Bonus: 3 enemies afflicted

perks.name: Prism
perks.description: After your creatures cast an Ethereal Spell Gem, they gain a random buff.

perks.name: Quickdraw
perks.description: After your creatures gain Ethereal Spell Gems, they have a 5% chance per rank to cast them. Only gems that are acquired after start-of-battle effects can be cast in this manner. Maximum Bonus: 100% chance

perks.name: Shimmer
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage per rank for each Ethereal Spell Gem they have equipped, up to 90% reduced damage. Maximum Bonus: 5% less damage per gem

perks.name: Spellslinger
perks.description: Your creatures Ethereal Spell Gems cast 1 additional time.

perks.name: Temporal Concentration
perks.description: Your creatures' Ethereal Spell Gems do not consume Charges when used.

perks.name: Unshackled
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Silenced.

perks.name: Wild Magic
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain 1 Ethereal Spell Gem that belongs to their class per rank. Maximum Bonus: 5 gems gained

perks.name: Embrace the Arcane (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures' spells that are Cast automatically have a 30% chance to be treated as manual casts.

name: Sorcerer
description:
Sorcerers are masters of controlling the battlefield. Why worry about offense or defense when your enemies can't move to begin with?
As a Sorcerer, you'll support your creatures by debilitating their enemies from afar. Generally, your enemies won't be able to act for the first few turns in battle as long as you're around.

perks.name: Calcify
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from a spell, they have a 5% chance per rank to be afflicted with Stone. Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Comfortable Proximity
perks.description: When your creatures take damage from an enemy, they take 1% less damage per rank for each creature between the two creatures on the timeline. Maximum Bonus: 10% less damage per creature

perks.name: Fade
perks.description: After your creatures take damage from an attack or spell, they gain Invisible.

perks.name: Flabbergast
perks.description: After your creatures deal damage with attacks or spells to the next enemy below them on the Timeline, that enemy has a 1% chance per rank to be sent to the bottom of the Timeline. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Gravity's Void
perks.description: When your creatures damage an enemy, they deal 1% more damage per rank for each other creature between the two creatures on the timeline. Maximum Bonus: 15% more damage per creature

perks.name: Mental Fortitude
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain Shelled.

perks.name: Perplex
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage, they have a 1% chance per rank to be afflicted with Confused. Maximum Bonus: 25% chance

perks.name: Psychic Scream
perks.description: After an enemy Casts a spell, they have a 4% chance per rank to be afflicted with Silenced. Maximum Bonus: 100% chance

perks.name: Ruin
perks.description: Your creatures deal 2% more damage and take 1.5% less damage (up to 90%) for each debuff each enemy has.

perks.name: Singe
perks.description: After an enemy Attacks, they have a 4% chance per rank to be afflicted with Scorned. Maximum Bonus: 100% chance

perks.name: Slipstream
perks.description: After the Timeline is determined at the start of battle, your creatures are moved up the Timeline 1 position higher per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 positions higher

perks.name: Spell of Roots
perks.description: At the end of an enemy's first turn, they are afflicted with Snared.

perks.name: Spell of Slumber
perks.description: At the end of an enemy's second turn, they are afflicted with Sleeping.

perks.name: Spell of Frost
perks.description: At the end of an enemy's third turn, they are afflicted with Frozen.

perks.name: Unity
perks.description: When your creatures deal damage, they deal 2.5% more damage per rank for each consecutive ally that is adjacent to them on the timeline. Maximum Bonus: 20% damage per consecutive ally

perks.name: Undertow (ASCENSION)
perks.description: At the start of each enemy's turn, they have a 10% chance that your Spell of Roots, Spell of Slumber, and Spell of Frost perks will activate. This chance is increased by an additional 10% each turn. After this perk activates, the chance is set back to 10%.

name: Paladin
description:
Eye for an eye, tooth for a tooth. Paladins are patient combatants who prefer to allow their enemies to strike first, and then return the favor tenfold with holy fury.
As a Paladin, your creatures will be able to endure even the most powerful of attacks. Each time your creatures take damage, they'll also damage their enemies.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Art of War
perks.description: When your creatures deal damage with Retribution, 1% of their highest stat per rank is added to the amount of damage dealt. Maximum Bonus: 30% of stat contributed

perks.name: Crusade
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 2% per rank of the amount of damage they've dealt with Retribution in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 100% Retribution damage

perks.name: Divine Intervention
perks.description: The first time your creatures would take fatal damage in battle, their Health is instead set to 1.

perks.name: Execution Sentence
perks.description: After your creatures are killed, they deal damage to all enemies equal to 100% of the amount of damage they dealt with Retribution in the current battle.

perks.name: Glory
perks.description: After your creatures deal damage with Retribution, their lowest stat is increased by 1% of the amount of damage dealt per rank. Maximum Bonus: Boost by 25% of damage

perks.name: Hand of Light
perks.description: After your creatures deal damage with Retribution, all your creatures recover Health equal to 2% of the damage dealt per rank. Maximum Bonus: Heal for 20% of damage dealt

perks.name: Light's Augmentation
perks.description: Your creatures have 3% more Defense per rank while they're Provoking. Maximum Bonus: 75% extra Defense

perks.name: Miraculous Recovery
perks.description: After your creatures Provoke, they recover 2% Health per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% health recovered

perks.name: Perseverance
perks.description: Your creatures take 2.5% less damage per rank while they're provoking. Maximum Bonus: 50% less damage

perks.name: Reckoning
perks.description: After your creatures Provoke, they Attack a random enemy.

perks.name: Retribution
perks.description: After your creatures take damage from an attack or spell, they deal damage to the enemy equal to 1% of the damage taken per rank. Maximum Bonus: Retaliate for 25% damage

perks.name: Seraphim
perks.description: At the start of battle, 1% of your creatures' Defense per rank is added to their Health. Maximum Bonus: 50% of Defense contributed

perks.name: Unbound
perks.description: After your creatures Provoke, they Defend.

perks.name: Wrath
perks.description: When your creatures deal damage with Retribution while they're Defending, the amount of damage is increased by 2% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% extra damage

perks.name: Zeal
perks.description: When your creatures deal damage with Retribution while they're Provoking, the amount of damage is increased by 2% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% extra damage

perks.name: Divine Toll (ASCENSION)
perks.description: After your creatures deal damage with Retribution, they Cast Holy Smite on the enemy as well.

name: Druid
description:
Many people foolishly mistake a Druid's introversion for weakness. These magi believe that quality always trumps quantity on the battlefield. Contrary to tradition, they are often seen with fewer than six creatures at their disposal, but the havoc their limited numbers wreak when augmented by Druidic magic is a sight to behold.
As a Druid, you'll probably only want to have one (or up to three, later on) creatures in your party. Your creatures will gain massive benefits for being part of a smaller party.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Adaptation
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain a random buff for each creature missing from your group.

perks.name: Ancestry
perks.description: At the start of battle, if you have at least 5 creatures missing from your group, your creatures gain 1 random trait that belong to their race per rank. Maximum Bonus: 2 random traits

perks.name: Aptitude
perks.description: Your creatures have a 10% chance to Cast spells an additional time for each creature missing from your group. This effect can occur repeatedly until it fails.

perks.name: Brood
perks.description: Your creatures have 1% more Maximum Health per rank for each creature missing from your group. Maximum Bonus: 20% more health

perks.name: Companion
perks.description: You can have 1 additional creature per rank in your group without it counting against other Druid perks. Maximum Bonus: 3 creatures

perks.name: Cornered
perks.description: Your creatures deal 1% more damage per rank for each creature missing from your group. Maximum Bonus: 20% more damage

perks.name: Disengagement
perks.description: Your creatures have an independent 10% chance to dodge attacks for each creature missing from your group.

perks.name: Guerilla Tactics
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures have a 10% chance to move to the top of the Timeline for each creature missing from your group.

perks.name: Killer Instinct
perks.description: Your creatures have an independent 10% chance to deal critical damage with attacks for each creature missing from your group.

perks.name: Lone Wolf
perks.description: Your creatures have 1% more Attack, Intelligence, Defense and Speed for each creature missing from your group. Maximum Bonus: 10% more stats

perks.name: Pack of One
perks.description: Your creatures have a 10% chance to Attack an additional time for each creature missing from your group. This effect can occur repeatedly until it fails.

perks.name: Reclusive Remedy
perks.description: If you have at least 5 creatures missing from your group, your creatures are resistant to debuffs.

perks.name: Sole Survivor
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage per rank for each creature missing from your group. Maximum Bonus: 10% less damage

perks.name: Sovreignty
perks.description: Your creatures have 1 additional Spell Gem slot for each creature missing from your group.

perks.name: FInal Stand (ASCENSION)
perks.description: If you only have 1 living creature, your dead creatures count as missing creatures.

name: Tribalist
description:
Strength in numbers. Tribalists prefer to use creatures that belong to the same race or class, and take full advantage of the synergy and camaraderie they offer each other.
As a Tribalist, you'll want to assemble a party of creatures that belong to the same race. This will provide them with significant benefits that are exacerbated by their racial synergies with each other.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Battalion
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain a random buff for each creature that belongs to the same race fighting on your side. Maximum of 6 buffs.

perks.name: Cogence
perks.description: Your creatures deal 2% more damage per rank to creatures that belong to their own class. Maximum Bonus: 50% more damage

perks.name: Familiarity
perks.description: Your creatures take 2% less damage per rank from creatures that belong to their own class. Maximum Bonus: 50% less damage

perks.name: Feign Death
perks.description: After your creatures are killed, they have a 1% chance per rank to resurrect with 50% Health for each creature that belongs to the same race fighting on your side. Maximum Bonus: 10% chance

perks.name: Fluster
perks.description: Your creatures have an independent 5% chance to dodge attacks for each creature that belongs to the same race fighting on your side.

perks.name: Forest Pact
perks.description: Traits, spells and other effects that are affected by the number of a certain creature race or class act as if you have 1 more of those creatures in your group per rank. Maximum Bonus: Boosted by 3

perks.name: Harbinger
perks.description: Your creatures' Spell Gems with any "Cast On..." property has a 1% greater chance per rank to activate for each creature that belongs to its race fighting on your side. Maximum Bonus: 5% greater chance

perks.name: Hybridization
perks.description: Your creatures have 1% more Attack, Intelligence, Defense and Speed per rank for each creature that belongs to the same race fighting on your side. Maximum Bonus: 5% more stats

perks.name: Overwhelm
perks.description: Your creatures have an independent 5% chance to deal critical damage with attacks for each creature that belongs to the same race fighting on your side.

perks.name: Purebred
perks.description: Your creatures have 1% more Attack, Intelligence, Defense and Speed per rank for each creature that belongs to the same class fighting on your side. Maximum Bonus: 5% more stats

perks.name: Survival Instincts
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage and deal 1% more damage per rank for each dead creature that belongs to the same race fighting on your side. Maximum Bonus: 10% more/less damage

perks.name: Ties That Bind
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage with attacks and spells equal to 1% of your other creatures' highest stats per rank that belong to the same race. Maximum Bonus: 5% stat contribution

perks.name: Transformation
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures cast their "Morph" spells if they have one of these spells in their top-most Spell Gem slot.

perks.name: Union
perks.description: Your creatures grant 1% of their highest stat per rank to your other creatures that belong to the same race. Maximum Bonus: 10% stat contribution

perks.name: We Are Pack
perks.description: At the start of battle, if you have at least 4 creatures that belong to the same race fighting on your side, the remaining creatures' races are changed to that race as well. This effect does not change a creature's race if it is an Imler.

perks.name: Gone But Not Forgotten (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Traits, spells and other effects that are affected by the number of a certain creature race or class now work with dead creatures as well.

name: Trickster
description:
Luck is not merely a matter of chance, but instead a force that can be manipulated to a clever man's will. Tricksters capitalize on this fact, enabling their creatures to re-roll the proverbial dice whenever fate doesn't turn out quite they way they hoped.
As a Trickster, you'll heavily inconvenience enemies by preventing them from taking action. You'll also gain the ability to manipulate the element of luck - for example, if a positive effect has a chance to activate but fails to do so, you can try again.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Bafflement
perks.description: At the start of battle, 1 enemy per rank is afflicted with Confused. Maximum Bonus: All six enemies

perks.name: Even the Odds
perks.description: At the start of normal battles, you have a 2% chance per rank to instantly kill a random enemy. If enemies are immune to this effect, they lose 20% of their Current Health instead. Maximum Bonus: 100% chance to kill

perks.name: Feint
perks.description: After your creatures dodge an attack, they have a 4% chance per rank to afflict the enemy with Disarmed. Maximum Bonus: 100% chance to inflict

perks.name: Hidden Hand
perks.description: Your artifacts' Spell Slots have a 2% additional chance per rank to be cast. Maximum Bonus: 15% extra chance

perks.name: Intent to Kill
perks.description: When the enemy would dodge your creatures' attacks, the dodge chance is re-rolled one additional time.

perks.name: Nightstalker
perks.description: At the start of battle, one creature in your party gains Invisible per rank, in order from first to last. Maximum Bonus: All creatures become invisible

perks.name: Pilfer
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures steal one random Spell Gem per rank from a random enemy. Maximum Bonus: 2 spell gems stolen

perks.name: Prey
perks.description: When your creatures Attack while the target is afflicted with Disarmed, the target's artifact's Stat Slots are applied to your creature for all effects that relate to that attack.

perks.name: Rebound
perks.description: When your creatures Attack, and their attack would fail to deal critical damage, the critical chance is re-rolled one additional time.

perks.name: Sleight of Hand
perks.description: Whenever it is one of your creatures' turns, any random effects that fail to occur are re-rolled an additional time.

perks.name: Spontaneity
perks.description: At random times during battle, your creatures have a 1% chance per rank to cast a random, Ethereal Spell Gem from their spell list.

perks.name: Stratagem
perks.description: Your creatures deal 2% more damage per rank while they're Invisible. Maximum Bonus: 100% extra damage

perks.name: Subterfuge
perks.description: Your creatures' attacks ignore 2% of the target's Defense per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% defense penetration

perks.name: Tools of the Trade
perks.description: Your artifacts' Trick Slots are 1% more powerful per rank. Maximum Bonus: 25% extra power

perks.name: Whetbone
perks.description: Your creatures always have Proficient.

perks.name: Immaculate Recovery (ASCENSION)
perks.description: When your creatures take damage from an attack or spell, they gain Invisible and Shelled.

name: Astrologer
description:
Astrologers are magi who specialize in creating a sound strategy before each battle. Oftentimes, their plans are so well-constructed that their creatures are able to take combat into their own hands without any further input from their master.
As an Astrologer, you'll plan most of your battle strategies before combat even begins. Astrologers allow their creatures to act on their own under certain conditions.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Ascendant
perks.description: Your creature with the highest Health starts battles at the top of the Timeline.

perks.name: Cusp
perks.description: If your creatures have at least 3 debuffs, they Defend at the end of their turn.

perks.name: Dying Stars
perks.description: If you have at least 3 dead creatures, your other creatures have a 1% chance per rank to resurrect one of them with 50% Health after they deal damage with an attack or spell. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Equinox
perks.description: If your creatures have at least 3 buffs, they gain a random minion at the start of their turn.

perks.name: Fixed Signs
perks.description: If your creatures have less than 80% Health, they heal themselves for 1% of their Maximum Health per rank at the start of their turn. Maximum Bonus: Heal for 20% of Maximum Health

perks.name: Lunar Eclipse
perks.description: Your creatures with the highest Intelligence per rank always Cast their top-most Spell Gem that has at least 1 Charge and isn't Sealed at the end of their turn. Maximum Bonus: Three creatures with the highest Intelligence

perks.name: Mercury Retrograde
perks.description: If your creatures have at least 3 debuffs, they are resistant to debuffs.

perks.name: New Moon
perks.description: If your creatures have at least 5 buffs when they are killed, they are resurrected with 25% Health. The number of buffs required for this perk to activate increases by 1 each time it activates.

perks.name: Solar Eclipse
perks.description: Your creatures with the highest Attack per rank always Attack at the end of their turn. Maximum Bonus: Three creatures with the highest Attack

perks.name: Stars Align
perks.description: If your creatures have at least 7 different minions, their attacks instantly kill enemies in normal battles, and deal 100% more damage in non-normal battles.

perks.name: Stellar Blessing
perks.description: Your creatures with the highest Intelligence per rank don't consume Charges when they Cast spells. Maximum Bonus: Three creatures with the highest Intelligence

perks.name: Summer Solstice
perks.description: Your creatures at the top half of the Timeline gain 1% Attack per rank at the start of each creature's turn. Maximum Bonus: 5% Attack gained

perks.name: Synastry
perks.description: Your creature with the highest Defense always Provokes at the end of their turn.

perks.name: Transit
perks.description: Your creature with the highest Speed always Attacks enemies that deal damage to it.

perks.name: Winter Solstice
perks.description: Your creatures at the bottom half of the Timeline gain 1% Defense per rank at the start of each creature's turn. Maximum Bonus: 5% Defense gained

perks.name: Protostar (ASCENSION)
perks.description: If your creatures have been killed in the current battle, they deal 90% more damage and take 60% less damage.

name: Doombringer
description:
The Doombringer draws magic from the Bastion of the Void to fuel his creatures with vast amounts of power. Doombringers specialize in allowing their creatures to perform actions multiple times in a row, all while nullifying his enemies' efforts.
As a Doombringer, your creatures' on-action effects (on-attack, on-cast, etc) can activate additional times, allowing you to chain brutal combos together to devastate your enemies. Doombringers are also able to prevent enemies' on-action effects from occurring as a defensive measure, as well.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Anger Management
perks.description: After your creatures' on-heal effects activate, their on-death effects activate as well.

perks.name: Aversion
perks.description: After your creatures' on-defend effects activate, their on-provoke effects activate as well.

perks.name: Blind Fury
perks.description: Your creatures' on-attack and on-cast effects trigger 1 additional time per rank after they Attack or Cast a spell. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional times

perks.name: Defiance
perks.description: Your creatures' on-heal, on-death and on-resurrect effects trigger 1 additional time per rank after they are healed, killed or resurrected. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional times

perks.name: Domination
perks.description: Your creatures have a 3% chance to avoid damage (up to 50%) for each time their on-buff, on-debuff, and on-minion effects activated in the current battle.

perks.name: Detainment
perks.description: Your creatures take 5% less damage (up to 90%) for each time their on-defend and on-provoke effects activated in the current battle.

perks.name: Eruption
perks.description: After your creatures' on-attack effects activate, their on-resurrect effects activate as well.

perks.name: Momentum
perks.description: Your creatures have a 5% chance per rank to double the value of all their actions (damage, healing, stat gains, etc). Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Obscuration
perks.description: Your creatures' on-critical and on-dodge effects trigger 1 additional time per rank after they deal critical damage or dodge. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional times

perks.name: Outburst
perks.description: Your creatures have 1% more stats (other than Health) per rank for each time their on-action effects activated in the current battle.

perks.name: Recklessness
perks.description: Your creatures have an independent 5% chance to deal critical damage and dodge attacks for each time their on-critical and on-dodge effects activated in the current battle.

perks.name: Siegebreaker
perks.description: Your creatures deal 10% more damage for each time their on-attack effects activated in the current battle.

perks.name: Soul Rending
perks.description: When your creatures are killed, they have a 5% chance (up to 50%) to be resurrected with 50% Health for each time their on-heal, on-death, and on-resurrect effects activated in the current battle.

perks.name: Unbound Hatred
perks.description: Your creatures' on-buff, on-debuff, and on-minion effects trigger 1 additional time per rank after they gain a buff, debuff, or minion. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional times

perks.name: Unleashed Power
perks.description: Your creatures' on-defend and on-provoke effects trigger 1 additional time per rank after they Defend or Provoke. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional times

perks.name: Juggernaut (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures deal 5% more damage for each time their on-action effects activated in the current battle.

name: Grovetender
description:
Grovetenders take great pride in their Herbling companions, strongly preferring to focus the bulk of their efforts on this prized creature over all the others. This peculiar mage knows just the right techniques to bring out her Herbling's full potential as it transforms rapidly in combat to wreak havoc on its foes.
As a Grovetender, you will always have a unique creature in your party called an Herbling. During battle, your creatures' actions will fertilize the Herbling, causing it to rapidly evolve until it turns into an unstoppable force of nature.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.
