perks.name: Acclimatization
perks.description: After one of your creatures is afflicted with a debuff, your Herbling Casts Nutrition on it. This perk can activate once per turn.

perks.name: Angry Orchard
perks.description: At the start of your Herbling's turn, it Casts Cruelty of the Wild. This spell has 20% more potency for each of your Herblings' Tiers.

perks.name: Biodegradation
perks.description: Your Herbling Attacks 1 additional time for each Tier it has.

perks.name: Cultivation
perks.description: At the start of your Herbling's turn, it gains 1% of each stat per rank for each Tier it has. Maximum Bonus: 10% of each stat

perks.name: Deep Roots
perks.description: If your Herbling is the first creature in your party, it Provokes at the end of its turn. If your Herbling is the sixth creature in your party, it Defends at the end of its turn.

perks.name: Defensins
perks.description: Your Herbling is resistant to debuffs. Your Herbling is unable to be afflicted with debuffs while it is at Tier 3 or higher.

perks.name: Eternal Blossom
perks.description: At the end of your Herbling's turn, it Casts Wild Growth. This spell affects a number of allies equal to its Tier.

perks.name: Nature's Wrath
perks.description: Your Herbling always has an additional buff for each Tier it has: Agile, Savage, Leeching, Splashing, Berserk, and Arcane.

perks.name: Offense Mechanism
perks.description: After your Herbling Attacks, it casts Shellbust on the target.

perks.name: Parasitic Fertilization
perks.description: At the start of your Herbling's turn, it casts Germinate. This spell affects a number of enemies equal to its Tier.

perks.name: Photosynthesis
perks.description: Your Herbling has 3% more stats (other than Health) for each time it has received healing, gained stats, received buffs or minions, or has been resurrected in battle. Every 15% stats earned through this perk causes the Herbling to evolve to a higher Tier at the start of its turn.

perks.name: Rapid Transformation
perks.description: Your Herbling deals 25% more damage and takes 15% less damage for each Tier it has.

perks.name: Strangler
perks.description: At the start of your Herbling's turn, enemies lose stats equal to 1% of your Herbling's stats per rank for each Tier it has. Maximum Bonus: 10% stat loss per Tier

perks.name: Symbiosis
perks.description: At the end of your creatures' turns, your Herbling gains 1 stack of Spiderlings.

perks.name: Synthetic Resin
perks.description: Your Herbling Casts 1 additional time for each Tier it has.

perks.name: Fertility (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your Herbling evolves 50% faster.

name: Purgatorian
description:
Purgatorians blur the line between life and death. These mystical spellcasters are able to call upon the spirits of their slain creatures to continue fighting in the afterlife.
As a Purgatorian, your creatures are able to continue fighting even while they're dead In fact, thanks to your powers, your creatures will be even stronger in the afterlife. Be careful not to let all your creatures die, though, or it's game over!
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Dark Covenant
perks.description: Your dead creatures have 5% more stats per rank. Maximum Bonus: 50% more stats

perks.name: Designated Survivor
perks.description: If you only have 1 living creature, it has a 5% chance per rank to avoid damage. Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Destiny Bond
perks.description: Your creatures' buffs and minions persist through death.

perks.name: Eternal Damnation
perks.description: Your creatures deal 1% more damage per rank for each time your creatures have been killed in the current batle. Maximum Bonus: 10% more damage

perks.name: From the Grave
perks.description: Your dead creatures Attack a random enemy for 10% additional damage per rank every 3 turns. Maximum Bonus: 100% additional damage

perks.name: Intangibility
perks.description: At the start of each enemy's turn, they have a 1% chance per rank to be sent to the bottom of the TImeline for each dead creature on your side. Maximum Bonus: 5% chance

perks.name: Last Word
perks.description: After your creatures Provoke, they give your creatures 3% of their stats per rank and are killed. Maximum Bonus: 30% stats given

perks.name: Life After Death
perks.description: Your creatures' traits are active even while they're dead. This perk does not affect traits that cause creatures to intercept or take damage in place of their allies.

perks.name: Madness
perks.description: Your creatures Attack 1 additional time for each dead creature on your side.

perks.name: Masochism
perks.description: Your creatures take 3% less damage per rank for each dead creature fighting on your side. Maximum Bonus: 15% less damage

perks.name: Medium
perks.description: Your creatures Cast spells 1 additional time for each dead creature on your side.

perks.name: Misery
perks.description: After your creatures are killed, one of your other creatures casts Murder of Crows.

perks.name: Never Forgotten
perks.description: Your creatures' stat changes persist through death.

perks.name: Psychic Suicide
perks.description: Your dead creatures Cast one of their spells with 10% more potency per rank every 5 turns. Maximum Bonus: 100% more potency

perks.name: Trauma
perks.description: Your creatures deal 3% more damage per rank for each dead creature on your side. Maximum Bonus: 30% more damage

perks.name: Time to Die (ASCENSION)
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures Provoke if their top-most Spell Gem slot is empty.

name: Rune Knight
description:
Rune Knights call upon their runic powers - Cor, Dun, Lua, Nax and Sah - to bolster their creatures' strength and grant them powerful spells that are unavailable anywhere else.
As a Rune Knight, your creatures will have access to powerful Rune spells. Your creatures can cast these spells to create cumulative bonuses for your entire party.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Aegis
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage per rank (up to 90%) for each time your creatures Cast Rune of Lua in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 3% less damage per Lua cast

perks.name: Aggression
perks.description: Your creatures deal 1% more damage per rank with attacks for each time your creatures cast Rune of Cor in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 10% more damage per Cor cast

perks.name: Covenant
perks.description: If your creatures have Cast each Rune spell at least once in the current battle, they activate your creatures' on-attack effects 1 additional time.

perks.name: Crescendo
perks.description: Your creatures gain and reduce stats 1% more per rank for each time your creatures Cast Rune of Dun in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 5% stat change potency per Dun cast

perks.name: Destiny
perks.description: Your creatures have an independent 1% chance per rank to dodge and deal critical damage for each time your creatures Cast Rune of Nax in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 10% chance per Nax cast

perks.name: Diabolism
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Silenced and their Rune Spell Gems cannot be Sealed.

perks.name: Discharge
perks.description: Your creatures' Rune spells have a 1% chance to target all enemies for each time your creatures Cast a Rune spell in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Embiggen
perks.description: Your creatures deal 1% more damage per rank with spells for each time your creatures cast rune of Sah in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 10% more damage per Sah cast

perks.name: Empowerment
perks.description: If your creatures have Cast each Rune spell at least once in the current battle, they Cast 1 additional time per rank and no longer consume Charges. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional casts

perks.name: Inspirit
perks.description: Your creatures' Rune spells grant them a buff which differs based on which spell it is. Cor: Savage Dun: Berserk Lua: Shelled Nax: Agile Sah: Arcane

perks.name: Rune of Lua
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Life creatures gain Rune of Lua.

perks.name: Rune of Cor
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Chaos creatures gain Rune of Cor.

perks.name: Rune of Dun
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Death creatures gain Rune of Dun.

perks.name: Rune of Nax
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Nature creatures gain Rune of Nax.

perks.name: Rune of Sah
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Sorcery creatures gain Rune of Sah.

perks.name: Ruse
perks.description: Your creatures' Rune spells are granted powerful properties at the start of battle. Magnetic, Increased Damage, and 24% Defense Penetration

perks.name: Undermine
perks.description: Your creatures' Rune spells afflict enemies with a debuff which differs based on which spell it is. Cor: Burning Dun: Bleeding Lua: Confused Nax: Poisoned Sah: Bomb

perks.name: Runic Might (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures' Rune spells have 10% more potency for each Charge they're missing.

name: Spellweaver
description:
Chaos, Death, Life, Nature and Sorcery: the five components that gave birth to the land of Rodia. Spellweavers can call upon these elements to imbue their creatures with powerful inscriptions to decimate their foes in battle.
As a Spellweaver, your creatures can cast spells to produce Infusions which can be expended for powerful effects. After your creatures accumulate enough Infusions, they can cast the powerful Colorwave spell to annihilate their enemies.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Attunement
perks.description: Your creatures have 5% more Attack, Intelligence, Defense, and Speed per rank for each Chaos, Sorcery, Death or Nature Infusions you have. Your creatures take 1% less damage per rank for each Life Infusion you have. Maximum Bonus: 25% more stats, 5% less damage per infusion

perks.name: Chaos Infusion
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast a Chaos spell, you gain 1 Chaos Infusion. When any of your creatures manually Cast a spell, they decrease the enemies' stats by 1% for each Chaos Infusion you have.

perks.name: Chromatic Layering
perks.description: You start battles with 1 Infusion per rank, up to 1 per class. Maximum Bonus: 5 Infusions

perks.name: Chrono Shift
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast a spell, they also Cast the Spell Gem below it.

perks.name: Death Infusion
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast a Death spell, you gain 1 Death Infusion. After any of your creatures manually Cast a spell, they afflict enemies with 1 random debuff as long as you have at least 1 Death Infusion, plus 1 additional random debuff for every 3 Death Infusions you have beyond that.

perks.name: Elemental Empowerment
perks.description: Your creatures' spells are 10% more potent per rank for each time your creatures have Cast Colorwave in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 25% more potency

perks.name: Eternal Echo
perks.description: Your creatures Cast spells 1 additional time per rank. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional casts

perks.name: Infinity
perks.description: After your creatures have collectively Cast Colorwave at least 5 times, they can continue to Cast it for the rest of the battle and it consumes no Infusions.

perks.name: Inspirited Gems
perks.description: Your creatures' "Cast On..." properties have a 1% additional chance per rank to activate. Maximum Bonus: 5% chance

perks.name: Life Infusion
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast a Life spell, you gain 1 Life Infusion. After any of your creatures manually Cast a spell, they heal your creatures for 10% of their Health for each Life Infusion you have, and gain a Barrier that absorbs damage equal to the amount of Health recovered.

perks.name: Nature Infusion
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast a Nature spell, you gain 1 Nature Infusion. After any of your creatures manually Cast a spell, their stats are increased by 3% for each Nature Infusion you have.

perks.name: Prismatic Barrier
perks.description: While you have at least 1 Infusion that matches your creatures' classes, those creatures are resistant to debuffs.

perks.name: Sorcery Infusion
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast a Sorcery spell, they gain 1 Sorcery Infusion. When any of your creatures manually Cast a spell, your creatures gain 1 random buff as long as you have at least 1 Sorcery Infusion, plus 1 additional random buff for every 3 Sorcery Infusions you have beyond that.

perks.name: Temporal Anomaly
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast a spell, they also Cast the Spell Gem above it.

perks.name: Ultimate Manifestation
perks.description: While you have at least 1 stack of each Infusion, your creatures can Cast Colorwave. After your creatures cast Colorwave, you lose 1 of each Infusion.

perks.name: Spectral Affinity (ASCENSION)
perks.description: When you gain an Infusion, you gain another Infusion of the type you have the least Infusions of.

name: Dreamshade
description:
Dreamshades blur the line between dreams and reality. This mystical magi is adept at redirecting his foes' efforts for his own benefit.
As a Dreamshade, you'll utilize the Inverted debuff to cause your foes' damage to instead heal your creatures, and their healing effects to damage their allies.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Antipode
perks.description: When an enemy with Inverted gains stats, they have a 50% chance to lose stats instead.

perks.name: Antithesis
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, they afflict the enemy with Inverted. The potency of this debuff is equal to 10% of the damage they caused per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% of the damage

perks.name: Contrarian
perks.description: When an enemy with Inverted gains a buff, they have a 50% chance to gain a random debuff instead.

perks.name: Counterintuitive
perks.description: When your creatures afflict each other with a debuff, they gain a random buff instead.

perks.name: Damned Visions
perks.description: After your creatures Cast a spell, they afflict a random enemy with Inverted. The potency of this debuff is equal to 10% of the caster's highest stat.

perks.name: Delusion of Grandeur
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage with attacks and spells equal to 1% of the enemy's Inverted potency per rank. Maximum Bonus: 10% of potency

perks.name: Edge of Reality
perks.description: After an enemy is killed, the potency of their Inverted debuff is added to the potency of all other enemies' Inverted debuffs.

perks.name: Eternal Dream
perks.description: Enemies cannot be immune to Inverted.

perks.name: Hallucination
perks.description: When your creatures reduce each others' stats, they gain those stats instead.

perks.name: Late Confessions
perks.description: When the enemies' Inverted debuff activates, there is a 5% chance per rank that its potency will not be decreased. Maximum Bonus: 50% chance

perks.name: Losing Touch
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Blighted.

perks.name: Lost in the Echo
perks.description: After an enemy is killed, all other enemies take damage equal to 10% of the potency of their Inverted debuff per rank. Maximum Bonus: 30% of the potency

perks.name: Paradox
perks.description: Your creatures can trigger healing effects even while they're at full Health.

perks.name: Question Everything
perks.description: When your creatures deal damage to each other, they are healed instead of taking damage.

perks.name: Unfurling Nightmare
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemies are afflicted with Inverted. The potency of this debuff is equal to 1% of their highest stat per rank. Maximum Bonus: 10% of highest stat

perks.name: Lucid Dreams (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Enemies' Inverted debuffs lose 50% less potency when they activate.

name: Siegemaster
description:
The Siegemaster is a stalwart protector who amplifies the defenses of his creatures to keep them strong in battle.
As a Siegemaster, you'll protect your creatures with powerful defensive mechanisms while they reflect damage taken back on their attackers. This specialization makes great use of the Defend command in battle.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Armor Shred
perks.description: Your creatures' attacks and spells ignore 1% of the enemies' Defense per rank. Maximum Bonus: 25% Defense ignored

perks.name: Barricade
perks.description: When your creatures are Defending, the creatures adjacent to them take 50% less damage.

perks.name: Defensive Stance
perks.description: Your creatures take 5% less damage (up to 90%) for each time they've Defended in the current battle.

perks.name: Explosive Armor
perks.description: After your creatures Defend, they gain 10% Defense and a Barrier that absorbs damage equal to the amount of Defense gained. If the creature already has a Barrier, it explodes, dealing damage to enemies equal to 50% of the Barrier strength.

perks.name: In Formation
perks.description: Your creatures start battles Defending.

perks.name: Last Stand
perks.description: When your creatures take damage that exceeds 100% of their Maximum Health, they have a 50% chance to be left with 1 Health.

perks.name: Lucidity
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Confused.

perks.name: No Weak Links
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain Defense equal to 50% of their highest stat.

perks.name: Rest Up
perks.description: After your creatures Defend, their Spell Gems gain 1 Charge.

perks.name: Shield Guard
perks.description: Your creatures gain 100% more benefit from their Artifacts' Stat Slots that increase Defense.

perks.name: Purge
perks.description: After your creatures Defend, their debuffs are removed and they gain a random buff for each debuff removed.

perks.name: The Best Offense
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage with attacks and spells equal to 3% of their Defense per rank. Maximum Bonus: 30% of Defense

perks.name: Thorns
perks.description: After your creatures take damage from an attack or spell, they deal damage to enemies equal to 15% of their Defense.

perks.name: Titanic Rage
perks.description: Your creatures deal 150% more damage to enemies that are Defending or Provoking.

perks.name: War Machine
perks.description: After your creatures Provoke, they Defend.

perks.name: Furious Protector (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures always deal critical damage and never dodge.

name: Windrunner
description:
Windrunners are vigilant sentinels who imbue their creatures with unmatched speed and vigor, allowing them to move so quickly that their opponents can't ever catch them.
As a Windrunner, you'll rely on the Speed stat to outplay your foes. This specialization also offers several ways to disable your enemies and prevent them from passing through your defenses.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Accumulation
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, they gain 1% Speed per rank, plus additional Speed equal to 1% per rank of the amount of Speed they've gained in the current battle. Maximum Bonus: 5% Speed

perks.name: Aeroforged
perks.description: Your creatures gain 3% more benefit from their Artifacts' Stat Slots per rank, other than Health. Maximum Bonus: 30% more benefit

perks.name: Born Again
perks.description: After your creatures are killed from start-of-battle effects, they are resurrected with 50% Health.

perks.name: Derivation
perks.description: After your creatures gain stats other than Speed, they gain Speed equal to 3% of the amount gained per rank. Maximum Bonus: 15% of the amount

perks.name: First Served
perks.description: After the order of the Timeline is determined at the start of battle, your creatures are moved up the Timeline 1 position higher per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 positions higher

perks.name: Further Beyond
perks.description: Increases your creatures' maximum stat limits before they are subjected to diminishing returns by 10% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% higher limit

perks.name: Inertia
perks.description: Your creatures cannot lose stats.

perks.name: Primordial
perks.description: Your creatures' Nether Stones are 5% more powerful per rank. This perk does not affect a Nether Stone's traits, spells, or any Trick Slots that increase a creature's maximum number of Spell Gem slots. Maximum Bonus: 50% more power

perks.name: Propulsion
perks.description: Your creatures take 1% less damage per rank (up to 90%) for every 100% Speed they have greater than their base Speed. Maximum Bonus: 10% less damage

perks.name: Quick Hands
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Disarmed.

perks.name: Retention
perks.description: Your creatures' stats are no longer reset after they're killed.

perks.name: Sidestep
perks.description: If your creatures' Speed is greater than 200% of their base Speed, they are resistant to debuffs.

perks.name: Singleton
perks.description: Enemies can only Attack and Cast spells once at a time.

perks.name: True Ending
perks.description: All creatures' on-death effects are ignored. This perk does not affect the Born Again perk. This perk does not work in boss battles.

perks.name: Velocity
perks.description: Your creatures' attacks and spells deal 3% of their damage per rank using Speed instead of Attack or Intelligence. Maximum Bonus: 30% of speed

perks.name: Zoom (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your creatures always dodge. The first time your creatures Attack in battle, they have a 100% chance to deal critical damage.

name: Fanatic
description:
Fanatics devote their lives to serving the gods. From dusk until dawn, these magi toil away at a neverending list of demands to better-serve each of the 21 gods of Rodia. Such devotion is not without purpose, however, for the Fanatic is able to call on the gods' power to serve him in his time of need.
As a Fanatic, you'll be able to take additional Avatar creatures with you on your journey and empower them and their Ultimate Spell Gems with potent magic. Fanatics also make use of Godspawn creatures and create powerful synergies between them and their Avatar allies.
NOTE: Fanatic is special even among non-starter specializations, as it requires you to obtain an Avatar creature and bring it to Everett when attempting to start the project to unlock it.

perks.name: Apostle
perks.description: After your Avatars Attack, your Godspawn have a 1% chance per rank to Attack a random enemy. Maximum Bonus: 10% chance

perks.name: Army of Gods
perks.description: You can have 1 additional Avatar creature per rank in your party. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional Avatars

perks.name: Canonization
perks.description: After your Avatars are killed, they give 10% of their stats per rank to your Godspawn. Maximum Bonus: 100% of stats given

perks.name: Deified Armaments
perks.description: Your creatures' Ultimate Spell Gems have 10% more potency per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% more potency

perks.name: Martyr
perks.description: After your Godspawn are killed, they are resurrected with 50% Health and transform into their respective Avatar.

perks.name: Multitheism
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Godspawn creatures gain their respective Avatars' trait.

perks.name: Nirvana
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Avatars gain 1 random Ultimate Spell Gem per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 Ultimate Spells

perks.name: Otherworldly
perks.description: Your Avatars are resistant to debuffs.

perks.name: Pact of the Gods
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Avatars' Ultimate Spell Gems gain the "Generous" property.

perks.name: Prophecy
perks.description: After your Godspawn Attack, they have a 1% chance per rank to Cast their respective Avatars' respective Ultimate Spell. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Syncretism
perks.description: After your Avatars Cast a spell, your Godspawn have a 1% chance per rank to Cast that spell as well. Maximum Bonus: 10% chance

perks.name: Transcendence
perks.description: After your Godspawn Cast a spell, they have a 1% chance per rank to Cast their respective Avatars' Ultimate Spell. Maximum Bonus: 20% chance

perks.name: Ultima
perks.description: All Avatars' Ultimate Spell Gems have 1 additional Charge per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 additional charges

perks.name: Undying Exaltation
perks.description: After your Avatars have been dead for 7 turns, they are resurrected with 50% Health.

perks.name: Unstoppable Force
perks.description: Ultimate Spell Gems cannot be Sealed.

perks.name: Godforged (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Your Avatars have 50% more benefit from the Godforge.

name: Toxicologist
description:
Toxicologists spend their days tarrying away at all manner of potions and elixirs that might serve their use in battle. These mad scientists care little for the well-being of their own creatures, equipping them with venomous toxins that grant them enhanced combat prowess at the cost of their own lives.
As a Toxicologist, you'll use the Poison debuff to inflict massive damage over time to your foes. You'll also Poison your own creatures to generate beneficial effects when they take damage.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Addictive Effect
perks.description: Your creatures deal additional damage equal to 4% of the potency of their Poisoned debuff per rank. Maximum Bonus: 20% of poison potency

perks.name: Bioassay
perks.description: Your creatures' spells that interact with Poisoned do not consume Charges.

perks.name: Breath of Death
perks.description: If an enemy dies while it is afflicted with Poisoned, all other enemies take damage equal to 50% of the potency of this debuff.

perks.name: Carcinogen
perks.description: Enemies always have Poisoned.

perks.name: Chronic Illness
perks.description: Your creatures take damage from Poison 1 additional time per rank. Maximum Bonus: 2 extra poison damages

perks.name: Confounding Factors
perks.description: Your creatures' spells that interact with Poisoned have 20% more potency per rank. Maximum Bonus: 100% extra potency

perks.name: Diagnosis
perks.description: Your creatures always have Poisoned. Your creatures can take a maximum of 50% of their Current Health as damage from Poisoned.

perks.name: Dispersing Plague
perks.description: After your creatures take damage from Poison, they have a 20% chance to Cast Virus.

perks.name: Inoculate
perks.description: Your creatures take 10% (up to 80%) less damage from attacks and spells for each time they've taken damage from Poisoned in the current battle.

perks.name: Neurotoxicity
perks.description: Enemies take 1% more damage from attacks and spells for each time each enemy has taken damage from Poisoned in the current battle.

perks.name: Plague of Toads
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, they have a 20% chance to Cast Toxic Frogmania.

perks.name: Prognosis
perks.description: After your creatures take damage from Poisoned, one of your other creatures is healed for the same amount.

perks.name: Side Effects
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from Poisoned, they are afflicted with a random debuff.

perks.name: Sudden Exposure
perks.description: After your creaturess take damage from Poisoned, a random enemy takes this damage as well.

perks.name: Teratogen
perks.description: After a creature takes damage from Poisoned, the potency of all enemies' Poisoned debuffs is increased by 5% per rank. Maximum Bonus: 25% potency boost

perks.name: Toxic Absorption (ASCENSION)
perks.description: After your creatures take damage from Poisoned, they gain stats (other than Health) equal to 50% of the damage received.

name: Shadowbringer
description:
The presence of a Shadowbringer spells doom for all who cross its path. This ethereal being bends the light into darkness, sapping its foes' will to live from their hearts.
As a Shadowbringer, you'll utilize the Blighted debuff to damage your foes using numerous healing effects.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Arrogance is Confidence
perks.description: Your creatures with Blighted ignore the effects of this debuff, and deal 50% more damage.

perks.name: Ascent of the Damned
perks.description: After your creatures attack, they cast Minor Healing, Healing, or Major Healing on themselves.

perks.name: Dark Souls
perks.description: After your creatures Attack, they cast Minor Healing, Healing, or Major Healing on the target.

perks.name: Dead Divinity
perks.description: Enemies' healing spells have 50% more potency.

perks.name: Doomsday
perks.description: After your creatures heal an enemy, they have a 25% chance to cast Ill Fate.

perks.name: Dystopia
perks.description: After an enemy casts a healing spell, each of your creatures have a 5% chance to Cast Shadow Crash.

perks.name: Fall From Grace
perks.description: Enemies receive 5% more healing for each time they've been damaged by Blighted in the current battle.

perks.name: Harrow
perks.description: Enemies gain 50% less benefit from stat-boosting effects.

perks.name: Leeches
perks.description: After an enemy attacks, it gains Leeching.

perks.name: Phantom Pain
perks.description: At the start of each enemy's turn, they have a 25% chance to cast Minor Healing on themselves.

perks.name: Self-fulfilling Prophecy
perks.description: After an enemy Casts a spell, it gains Mending.

perks.name: Shadow Mending
perks.description: Your creatures always have Leeching and Mending.

perks.name: Shadow Sickness
perks.description: Enemies always have Blighted.

perks.name: Touch of Darkness
perks.description: After your creatures damage an enemy, the enemy is healed for 20% of the damage dealt.

perks.name: Worldbreaker
perks.description: Enemies take 100% more damage from Blighted.

perks.name: Endwalker (ASCENSION)
perks.description: If an enemy dies while it is afflicted with Blighted, it cannot be resurrected.

name: Engineer
description:
The Engineer's sole purpose in life is to build a bigger and better explosive than last time. This bombastic bombardier belays bombs to its opponent's backs, blasting them back to the bilgewater from whence they were born.
As an Engineer, you'll strap bombs to enemies and blow them to bits. The Engineer is also accompanied by their greatest invention: the Microbot minion!
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Annealment
perks.description: Enemies take 35% more indirect damage.

perks.name: Dimensional Stability
perks.description: Enemies' Bomb debuffs detonate 1 additional time per rank. Maximum Bonus: 2 additional detonations

perks.name: Dismantlement
perks.description: Enemies deal 5% less damage (up to 80%) for each time they've been damaged by Bomb in the current battle.

perks.name: Drone Bait
perks.description: After an enemy's Bomb debuff detonates, one of your creatures gains 1 stack of Microbots per rank. Maximum Bonus: 3 stacks of Microbots

perks.name: Energy Efficient
perks.description: Your creatures' spells that interact with Bomb do not consume Charges.

perks.name: Extrusion
perks.description: Enemies' Bomb debuffs deal 50% more damage for each time they've been damaged by this debuff in the current battle.

perks.name: Grand Finale
perks.description: After your creatures are killed, they cast Corpse Explosion.

perks.name: Heat Distortion
perks.description: Enemies with Bomb have 20% less stats (excluding Health).

perks.name: Impact Resistance
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from Bomb, your creatures gain a Barrier that absorbs damage equal to 100% of the damage dealt.

perks.name: Light the Fuse
perks.description: After your creatures attack, they cast Pyroburst on the target.

perks.name: Locked and Loaded
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, they have a 20% chance to cast Explosive Arrow on a random enemy.

perks.name: Pinpoint
perks.description: Your creatures deal 5% more damage per rank to enemies with Bomb. Maximum Bonus: 50% more damage

perks.name: Primed and Ready
perks.description: At the start of battle, enemies are afflicted with Bomb.

perks.name: Prototype
perks.description: The potency of enemies' Bomb debuffs that are applied after start-of-battle effects is based on your creatures' highest stats (other than Health) instead of Speed.

perks.name: Renewable Armaments
perks.description: After an enemy's Bomb detonates, it has a 35% chance to be afflicted with Bomb again.

perks.name: Chain Reaction (ASCENSION)
perks.description: After an enemy takes damage from Bomb, all other enemies take this damage as well.

name: Brewmaster
description:
The Brewmaster believes that no problem can't be solved with a full mug of beer... or six. This unexpected hero generously distributes all manner of ales and cocktails to friend and foe alike - but all should be wary when the time comes to pay the bill.
As a Brewmaster, you'll rely on Booze spells to... well... make everyone get really, really drunk.

perks.name: Autograt
perks.description: After start-of-battle effects are determined, your creatures' Booze spells gain the â€˜Chance to Attack', â€˜Chance to Defend', and â€˜Chance to Provoke' properties.

perks.name: Brewmaster's Handshake
perks.description: Your creatures can cast Booze spells manually.

perks.name: Chaser
perks.description: After your creatures manually cast a Booze spell, they have a 50% chance to Cast a random spell. Otherwise, they Attack a random enemy.

perks.name: Double Entendre
perks.description: Your creatures' Booze spells also have a chance to be Cast at the start of the equipped creatures' turns.

perks.name: Experimental Cocktail
perks.description: At the start of battle, your creatures gain all Booze spells that belong to their class.

perks.name: Highball
perks.description: Your creatures' Booze spells count 50% less against their per-turn Casting limit.

perks.name: Inebriation
perks.description: Enemies have a 5% chance (up to 80%) to deal no damage for each time they've been affected by an Booze spell in the current battle.

perks.name: Liquid Courage
perks.description: Your creatures deal 3% more damage for each time they've cast a Booze spell in the current battle.

perks.name: Muddle
perks.description: Your creatures attack 1 additional time (up to 3) for every 5 Booze spells they've Cast in the current battle.

perks.name: Nightcap
perks.description: Enemies cannot be resurrected if they have been affected by Booze spells at least 3 times in the current battle.

perks.name: Numb the Pain
perks.description: Your creatures have a 5% chance (up to 80%) to avoid damage for each time they've been affected by an Booze spell in the current battle.

perks.name: On The House
perks.description: Your creatures' Booze spells do not consume Charges.

perks.name: Speed Rail
perks.description: Your creatures cast Booze spells 1 additional time (up to 3) for every 5 Booze spells they've cast in the current battle.

perks.name: Straight Up
perks.description: Your creatures' Booze spells cannot be Sealed.

perks.name: Top Shelf
perks.description: Your creatures' Booze spells have a 100% increased chance to be cast.

perks.name: Drunken Camaraderie (ASCENSION)
perks.description: Enemies take a moderate amount of damage and your creatures are healed for a moderate amount when they are affected by your creatures' Booze spells.

name: Demonologist
description:
The Demonologist is a wicked summoner who conjures terrible demons from the depths of hell to aid his creatures in battle. This chaotic sorcerer uses Greater Demons to do his bidding while sacrificing Lesser Demons to empower his own creatures.
As a Demonologist, you'll summon powerful demons from the depths of hell to do your bidding.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Brim Fiends
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, they gain 1 stack of Brim Fiends.

perks.name: Chaos Satyrs
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, they gain 1 stack of Chaos Satyr.

perks.name: Demonic Consumption
perks.description: After any number of stacks of your creatures' Lesser or Greater Demons go away, they recover 100% Health.

perks.name: Demonic Pact
perks.description: Your creatures have 10% more stats (excluding Health) for each different Greater Demon your creatures have.

perks.name: Drained Essence
perks.description: Your creatures deal 3% more damage for each time all your creatures' minions went away in the current battle.

perks.name: Final Summoning
perks.description: After your creatures' Greater Demons go away, they cast a powerful spell depending on which Greater Demon went away.

perks.name: Fire Imps
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, they gain 1 stack of Fire Imps.

perks.name: Inner Demons
perks.description: After any number of stacks of your creatures' Lesser Demons go away, they gain 15% stats.

perks.name: Reawakening
perks.description: After your creatures sacrifice a Lesser Demon, each stack has a 35% chance to resurrect.

perks.name: Renounce the Light
perks.description: Your creatures cannot gain buffs or minions that are unrelated to this specialization. This perk is always active while your specialization is Demonologist, even if you haven't allocated any Perk Points to it.

perks.name: Soul Shield
perks.description: Your creatures take 3% less damage (up to 80%) for each time all your creatures' minions went away in the current battle.

perks.name: Summon Asmodeus
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Chaos creatures gain Asmodeus.

perks.name: Summon Beelzebub
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Death creatures gain Beelzebub.

perks.name: Summon Belphegor
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Sorcery creatures gain Belphegor.

perks.name: Summon Leviathan
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Nature creatures gain Leviathan.

perks.name: Summon Mammon
perks.description: At the start of battle, your Life creatures gain Mammon.

perks.name: Summon Satanachia
perks.description: At the start of battle, if your creatures collectively have Asmodeus, Beelzebub, Mammon, Leviathan, and Belphegor, they gain Satanachia.

perks.name: Void Shift
perks.description: When your creatures' Greater Demons would go away, they move to a different creature fighting on your side instead.

perks.name: Summon Lucifer (ASCENSION)
perks.description: At the start of battle, if your creatures collectively have Asmodeus, Beelzebub, Mammon, Leviathan, and Belphegor, your creatures gain Lucifer.

name: Gladiator
description:
The Gladiator is a master of the arena, sporting tremendous proficiency with all manner of weapons. No sword, no axe, no bow is too difficult for this master of armaments to wield.
As a Gladiator, you'll utilize powerful Arsenal spells to bolster your forces and devastate your opponents. In addition, your creatues' Artifacts will become far stronger than normal.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Acclimated Armaments
perks.description: Your creatures' Arsenal spells are 5% more potent for each time they've Cast an Arsenal spell in the current battle.

perks.name: Blacksmith's Boon
perks.description: Your creatures' Trick Slots that apply buffs and debuffs have a 35% greater chance to activate.

perks.name: Crowd Favorite
perks.description: After your creatures' Trick Slots activate, they gain a random Arsenal Spell.

perks.name: Double Time
perks.description: Your creatures' Trick Slots that apply buffs and debuffs affect 1 additional creature.

perks.name: Elbow Grease
perks.description: Your creatures gain 50% more benefit from their Artifact's Stat Slots.

perks.name: Frenzy
perks.description: Your creatures deal 15% more damage with attacks and spells for each debuff they afflicted from all your Artifacts' Trick Slots.

perks.name: Grip of the Gods
perks.description: Your creatures are immune to Disarmed.

perks.name: Helping Hand
perks.description: After your creatures' Trick Slots activate, they resurrect an ally with 50% Health. If none of your creatures are dead, they heal an ally for 50% Health instead.

perks.name: Impending Victory
perks.description: 50% of the potency of your creatures' Arsenal Spells is based on their highest stat instead of Intelligence.

perks.name: It's Called a Lance
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast an Arsenal Spell, they cast a Living Lance spell. The type of Living Lance spell is based on the caster's class.

perks.name: Nether Imbuement
perks.description: Your creatures' Nether Stones are 5% more powerful per rank. This perk does not affect a Nether Stone's traits, spells, or any Trick Slots that increase a creature's maximum number of Spell Gem slots. Maximum Bonus: 50% more powerful

perks.name: Reprimand
perks.description: After your creatures Provoke, their Ethereal Spell Gems are transformed into random Arsenal Spells.

perks.name: Taking Measure
perks.description: Your creatures take 10% less damage (up to 80%) for each buff they gained from all your Artifacts' Trick Slots.

perks.name: Turn the Tables
perks.description: After your creatures manually Cast an Arsenal spell, they Attack a random enemy for 50% more damage.

perks.name: War Paint
perks.description: Your creatures have 10% more stats (other than Health) for each non-Ethereal Arsenal Spell they have equipped.

perks.name: Killing Machine (ASCENSION)
perks.description: At the end of your creatures' turns, each of their Arsenal Spells have a 5% chance to be Cast.

name: Graveborn
description:
The Graveborn is a once-powerful warlock who was killed for his heresy and has since risen from the dead to wreak havoc on the living. This undead spellcaster is capable of bringing his creatures back from the dead with far greater power than before.
As a Graveborn, you'll bring empowered versions of your creatures back from the dead to wreak havoc on your enemies.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Carapace That Protects
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they gain 25%, 50%, and 100% Defense.

perks.name: Claws That Cast
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they gain 25%, 50%, and 100% Intelligence.

perks.name: Death's Bane
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they attack random enemies 1, 2, and 3 times.

perks.name: Death's Echo
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they Cast their spells at random 1, 2, and 3 times.

perks.name: Dread Covenant
perks.description: Your creatures take 25% less damage (up to 80%) for each time they've been resurrected in the current battle.

perks.name: Eternal Legacy
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they gain a random trait that belongs to their race.

perks.name: Graveborn Bargain
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they gain 1, 2, and 3 random buffs.

perks.name: Heart That Thrives
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they gain 25%, 50%, and 100% Maximum Health.

perks.name: Jaws That Bite
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they gain 25%, 50%, and 100% Attack.

perks.name: Legs That Carry
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures are resurrected, they gain 25%, 50%, and 100% Speed.

perks.name: Mortal Vessel
perks.description: Your creatures deal 50% more damage with attacks and spells for each time they've been resurrected in the current battle.

perks.name: Past Life Regression
perks.description: Your creatures' stat changes persist through death.

perks.name: Somnus
perks.description: The first 3 times your creatures die, they are resurrected with 25%, 50%, and 100% Health. Your creatures cannot be resurrected by any other means. Your creatures' on-ressurect effects can activate only once at a time. This perk is always active while your specialization is Graveborn, even if you haven't allocated any Perk Points to it.

perks.name: Unnatural Causes
perks.description: Your creatures that have been resurrected at least 1 time are resistant to debuffs. Your creatures that have been resurrected at least 3 times always have Immune.

perks.name: Visitors From Before
perks.description: Your creatures' buffs and minions persist through death.

perks.name: From Beyond the Grave (ASCENSION)
perks.description: If your creatures have been resurrected at least 3 times in battle, their traits are active even while they're dead. This perk does not affect traits that cause creatures to intercept or take damage in place of their allies.

name: Mime
description:
While the Mime's own combat prowess leaves much to be desired, it excels at copying it's opponent's actions, turning its enemies' strategy against them to assure victory.
As a Mime, you'll enable your creatures to copy the actions of your opponents and grow stronger based on how your enemies behave in battle.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature.

perks.name: Bewilderment
perks.description: After an enemy attacks, it has a 25% chance to be afflicted with Blind.

perks.name: Circus Walk
perks.description: The first time your creatures Attack each turn, your other creatures have a 15% chance to Attack the enemy as well.

perks.name: Clic
perks.description: The first time your creatures Attack each turn, the target has a 15% chance to attack itself as well.

perks.name: Finger Painting
perks.description: When an enemy gains a buff, one of your creatures gains that buff as well.

perks.name: Follow the Leader
perks.description: The first time your creatures Cast a spell each turn, your other creatures have a 15% chance to Cast that spell as well.

perks.name: Gesticulation
perks.description: After an enemy Provokes, one of your creatures Provokes as well.

perks.name: Imitation
perks.description: The first time an enemy Casts a spell each turn, one of your creatures Casts that spell as well.

perks.name: Immobility
perks.description: At the start of your creatures' turns, they have a 10% chance to Cast Aggravate.

perks.name: Mock
perks.description: After an enemy casts a spell, it has a 25% chance to be afflicted with Confused.

perks.name: Pressure
perks.description: The first time an enemy Attacks each turn, one of your creatures Attacks a random enemy.

perks.name: Pull the Rope
perks.description: When an enemy afflicts your creatures with a debuff, a random enemy is afflicted with that debuff as well.

perks.name: Stationary Walk
perks.description: Your creatures take 5% less damage (up to 80%) for each time an enemy has Cast a spell in the current battle.

perks.name: Stillness and Silence
perks.description: Enemies always have Cursed.

perks.name: The Lean
perks.description: Your creatures deal 5% more damage with attacks and spells for each time an enemy has Attacked in the current battle.

perks.name: Trapped In a Box
perks.description: After an enemy Defends, one of your creatures Defends as well.

perks.name: Fidelity (ASCENSION)
perks.description: The chance for your Mime perks to activate is doubled.

name: Deprived
description:
The Deprived was born with nothing and will die with nothing. Cursed with the intelligence of a sponge and the physique of a sickly child, the Deprived must make do with what little fate has left him with.
As a Deprived, you'll lose access to your most significant sources of power, including Fused traits, Avatar creatures, and Relic effects. This is a Challenge Specialization, and it will not appear at the Goblet of Giving after you unlock it.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature. It is also a Challenge Specialization, meaning it makes you weaker rather than stronger.

perks.name: Total Deprivation
perks.description: Your creatures' Fused traits are ignored. You cannot use Avatar creatures. Your creatures' Relic effects are ignored. This perk is always active while your specialization is Deprived, even if you haven't allocated any Perk Points to it.

perks.name: Simple Life (ASCENSION)
perks.description: You have a 100% increased chance to find Skins. This perk is always active, even if your specialization is not Deprived.

name: Pariah
description:
The Pariah is a social outcast who prefers to spend her days in solitude. Though her friends are few, she is resourceful enough to maintain her indepdendence with some success.
As a Pariah, you'll be forced to fight using a more limited number of creatures than usual. This is a Challenge Specialization, and it will not appear at the Goblet of Giving after you unlock it.
This is an Advanced specialization and as such cannot be chosen at the beginning, nor does it get a starter creature. It is also a Challenge Specialization, meaning it makes you weaker rather than stronger.

perks.name: Introversion
perks.description: You can only use 3 creatures at a time. Your Druid anointments are ignored. This perk is always active while your specialization is Pariah, even if you haven't allocated any Perk Points to it.

perks.name: Lifelong Respite (ASCENSION)
perks.description: You have a 25% increased chance to find Nether Stones. This perk is always active, even if your specialization is not Pariah.

name: Royal
description:
Authority is passed down through generations, but true power must be earned. A master of all professions, the Royal possesses the unique ability to combine the powers of other specializations at will.
As a Royal, you'll be able to use more Anointments than anyone else, allowing you to create your own, custom specialization.
NOTE: Royal is special even among non-starter specializations, as it requires you to unlock all other specializations before you can start the project to unlock it.

perks.name: Master of All
perks.description: You can equip 10 additional Anointments.

perks.name: Highborn (ASCENSION)
perks.description: You can equip 3 additional Anointments, or 5 if you've ascended all other specializations.
